conbody.p: The subscription-based version of Fluenta can be integrated into publishing and editing workflows via its Command Line Interface (CLI).
The methods exposed by Fluenta's CLI are:

ul.li: Generate XLIFF files and optional word counts;
Import a TMX file into a memory;
Export a memory as TMX file;

conbody.p: On macOS and Linux use fluenta_cli.sh for executing Fluenta without the graphical user interface.

ul.li: On macOS the default location for the script is /Applications/Fluenta.app/Contents/Resources/app/fluenta_cli.sh
On Linux the default location for the shell script is /opt/Maxprograms/Fluenta/fluenta_cli.sh

conbody.p: On Windows use fluenta_cli.cmd (available in the default installation directory) to process command line parameters.
conbody.note: Before you can use the Command Line Interface (CLI), you must start Fluenta from its Graphical User Interface (GUI) at least once.
